definition: to make a concession/to be accommodating
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])

sentences.english: Why did he let them suffer such cruel hardships?
sentences.chinese: 祂爲何容讓他們飽受如此殘酷的虐待？

sentences.english: True love respects each other's choice, and allows real freedom of one's own.
sentences.chinese: 真愛是尊重對方的選擇，容讓對方擁有真正的自由。

sentences.english: There are a lot of things held constant.
Ture love respects each other's choice, and allows real freedom of one's own.
sentences.chinese: 真愛是尊重對方的選擇，容讓對方擁有真正的自由。

sentences.english: No one can grow while these sins are present.
sentences.chinese: 當人容讓罪在心中滋長，就不可能在靈裏成長。

sentences.english: The next time you are forbidden to do something. Try to give your imagination some space.
sentences.chinese: 下次聽到小心不準動時，容讓想象力多一點空間。

sentences.english: Jesus welcomes the interruption and invites Bartimaeus to a lifetime of faith.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌容讓巴底買打擾，並邀請他接受一個信心的生命。

definition: to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
to get straight to the point (idiom)
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
to whisper to one another's ear
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention
to revisit old haunts (idiom); down memory lane
